page.title: 09GOOSTREY CHURCHES
page.content: {St.Luke's Church,}Goostrey dates from 1792. It is brick-built and replaced a thirteenth century timber framed building. There was probably a fortified manor house on the site as the remains of a moat are visible.The Red Lion Pub uses the old moat as a beer garden. There are three regular Sunday services.Holy Communion is at 8.00a.m. with either Matins or a family service at 10.45.Evensong is at 6.30p.m. {Goostrey Methodist Church}was built in 1785.It has a Sunday School hall which is used on week days for dancing classes,badminton and the play group. One of the two Sunday services is usually lead by the Minister,the other by a local preacher.Goostrey shares its Minister with Holmes Chapel.During the week regular Prayer meetings are held in the homes of members.
